cold_snaps.status: At present, there is no cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps occur annually.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference so far is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: No active heatwave is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The storm today is ranked 8th for the amount of rainfall recorded during one storm.  13.04mm fell at a maximum rate of {this_max}mm per hour over 7.9 hours.  Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 27.64mm over 15.9 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking first from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.

storm.status: Rain fell for 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 creating a new record.  The storm produced a total of 24.56mm at a maximum intensity of 6.4mm per hour.
Storm conditions are present now.  It is the first storm in the region since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting August 26, 2025, is ranked 4th among the longest rainy periods since August 2024.  It has lasted 9 days consecutively so far.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on July 18, 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (206°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 79.45 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 Oct 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1659 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 71.1m lower than yesterday, 555.3m lower than the past week, 1659.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 713m to a maximum of 1594m, averaging 995.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1551.1m and 2650m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. Some rain can be expected, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and bright intervals likely. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
